sub_title: Policy, Projects and Programs | Operations & Management | Communications | Analytics
summary:
Value driven professional with a particular interest in humanitarian and social affairs with a focus on policy, operations, communication and data analytics. I am energetic and passionate with a pleasant attitude that I strive to bring to any team.  I enjoy travelling, tasty food & good conversation.

Strengths include my inherent organisational and analytical skills and empathic nature which lends itself to the capacity for strong relationship building including developing cohesive teams. In addition, my ability for critical thinking and high level communication skills have been honed through my tertiary studies in the field of psychology and in various policy and operational based roles.

I do well and thrive in fast paced environments and take great pride in my profession.

treasury_media.title: Go Your Own Way Kit Video Resource
treasury_media.description: CREATE's Go Your Own Way (GYOW) kit is a resource to support young people preparing to transition to independence. This video showcases some amazing young people who have transitioned from care talking about their experiences leaving care, we well as myself talking about the advantages of the resource from a caseworker perspective.

treasury_media.title: Di Farmer MP Round Table Royal Commission Implementation
treasury_media.description:
Thank you to these wonderful people, who all run organisations that look after children who can’t live with their families.We spent a lot of time today talking about how we can all work best with the recommendations of the Royal Commission into the sexual abuse of children in institutions. So much horror was uncovered by the Royal Commission and there is absolute determination that history doesn’t repeat itself.
https://bit.ly/2Bh1M9Q

profile_positions.description: The Reportable Conduct Scheme seeks to improve organisations responses to allegations of child abuse and neglect by workers and volunteers and was a key recommendation from the Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse. In the ACT, organisations are legally required to report allegations of ''reportable conduct' against child and young people to the Ombudsman's Office. The  Office's role is to ensure compliance with the Scheme by overseeing and monitoring how organisation respond and investigate allegations of potential harm against children.
profile_positions.title: Policy Advisor and Case Officer - ACT Reportable Conduct Scheme

profile_positions.description: I relocated to Canberra, ACT after my secondment as Children Services Manager. I was able to utilise my operational and managerial experience to progress Aruma's policy priorities.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer

profile_positions.description:
Aruma (Formerly House with no Steps) is one of the largest disability service providers in Australia. They are one of few providers in Australia that provide residential out-of-home care services specifically for children with disabilities who are placed in the child protection system.

I relocated from Newcastle, NSW to Brisbane, Queensland and was offered a secondment in the operational arm of the organisation. I had approximately 35 staff/direct reports across 4 residential houses that houses approximately 13 children and young people in out-of-home care. My role was to ultimately ensure high quality care for the children, through my leadership and management of my team of youth worker/support workers. 

Key achievements/responsibilities/outcomes included:
● Case management through regular assessment, planning, implementing, monitoring and evaluating of needs. This included development of a tools comprehensively track and update compliance with young person's goals and care needs through case plans, health care plans, behaviour support plans etc and increased compliance with plan implementation. 
● People management including recruitment and interviewing of potential employees, fostering a positive workplace culture which was reflected by lower than average staff turnover, rostering and employee performance management when necessary.
● Financial management including negotiation of service agreements and funding, managing associated budgets including labour targets
profile_positions.title: Operations Manager - Children Services

profile_positions.description:
Aruma (Formerly House with no Steps) is one of the largest disability service providers in Australia. They support both adults and children across Queensland, New South Wales (NSW), Australian Capital Territory (ACT) and Victoria.

My role was to oversee the information management system as it pertained to policies and procedures. This involved ensuring the organisational policies and procedures meet legislative and regulatory requirements and that as an organisation, we have solid frameworks for establishing a benchmark for best practice. This included work using 'Easy English' and 'Plain English' to ensure information was accessible. I was required to provide timely, accurate and persuasive advice supported by clear analysis and contextual understanding of the NDIS, child safety frameworks and other best practice measures and to ensure policies and procedures were compliant. 

Key achievements/responsibilities/projects included: 
● Managing the re-development of the Children Services policy framework. This involved project planning and providing strategic leadership and direction around the review, development and implementation of the approach. I led and convened the national children review committee and was responsible for the researching, analysing and synthesising stakeholder information to produce policies and procedures.
● Synthesising pre-existing documents and significant re-development of some, based on research into legislation, standards and practice identified through internal and external stakeholder consultation. Included work on following documents: Service Agreements, Positive Behaviour Support, Sexuality, Restrictive Practices PPM, Specialist Disability Accommodation, Complaints & Feedback. 
● Supporting shared services and operational staff in safeguarding through compliance with audits including NDIS, Human Services Quality Framework (HSQF) in Queensland, Human Service Standard in Victoria and Child Safe Standard in Victoria & NSW.
●
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer

profile_positions.description:
CREATE foundation is the national peak consumer body representing the voices of children with an out-of-home care experience in Australia (that is statutory, child protection involvement). 

Key achievements/responsibilities/projects included: 

● Managing national projects such as the CREATE national Survey which resulted in over 1500 participants nationally 
● Supporting 8 state coordinators in achieving the  advocacy strategic goals
● Support to states in their yearly consultations with young people including analysing and synthesising qualitative data, proofing and editing of final reports
● Liaising with stakeholders including proposal submissions and project collaboration 
● Using an evidence base to inform change and elevate the voices of young people with a care experience such as inquiry submissions and writing of research reports particularly young person reports. Examples of my work (which remain the property of CREATE Foundation) can be found below on the CREATE website.
profile_positions.title: Policy & Advocacy Officer

profile_positions.description:
My strong organisational skills and capacity to prioritise and manage workload were key factors leading to me being approached for a secondment as marketing coordinator. 

This role primarily involved facilitating design projects in line with CREATE brand guidelines and contributing organisation brand guidelines to produce both internal and externally facing content. This included heavy collaboration with designers which I facilitated, as well as copy writing and editing, design briefing and design editing. This included social elements like e-signatures, web banners and social media banners as well as larger content such as information posters and research reports.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Communications Coordinator

profile_positions.company: Department of Communities, Child Safety and Disability Services
profile_positions.description:
As a Child Safety Officer I worked primarily within the Investigations and Assessment team within the Department of Communities, Child Safety and Disability Services (now Department of Child Safety, Youth and Women) . Primarily, I was responsible for providing statutory child protection services in accordance with legislation and practice guidelines utilising a strengths based framework and structured decision making practices.

This role entailed managing both emotional and practical aspects efficiently and effectively. For example, managing and ensuring the respect and dignity when dealing with clients and stakeholders, particularly in crisis driven situations, while also having the skills to write comprehensively and analytically E.G delivery of case plans and affidavits.
profile_positions.title: Child Safety Officer

profile_positions.description:
Safe Places is a therapeutic residential care provider that caters for young people placed on statutory child protection orders that require alternative care. While, in Australia, home/family based placements are the preferred options for young people in care, sometimes these placements are not suitable and an alternative environment is sought. In particular, Safe Places is known for catering towards young people with particularly volatile trauma responses that require one-on-one support. 

The role required working 24 hour shifts in 2-on-1 tenanted households (2 young people to one youth worker). The primary role was to meet the daily care needs of the young people as any carer would.

Key achievements/responsibilities/projects included: 
● Building rapport and providing emotional support
● Managing complex and challenging behaviours such as physical and verbal aggression, sexualised behaviours and property damage
● Preparing detailed reporting for timely submission to managers and stakeholders E.G  risk assessments, case notes, comprehensive outcomes
● Working as part of a care team to ensure therapeutic interventions to develop young person's capacity and understanding


As part of my professional development I received extensive training in trauma and attachment which complemented by studies in psychology as well as Therapeutic Crisis Intervention training developed by Cornell University.
profile_positions.title: Youth Worker

profile_positions.description:
Merlo Coffee is Australia's largest independently owned and operated coffee roaster. They own and operate a number of stores and supply more than 1500 cafes and restaurants across Australia. 

I worked in a fast paced customer service environment as a barista in one of the top performing and busiest Merlo cafes in Brisbane CBD. My customer service skills coupled with my experience in business administration led to me also taking on an additional role of Administration Assistant in the head office; I worked both roles concurrently. 

I can make a great coffee (always an asset, right?).

Key responsibilities included: 
● Promoting a welcoming environment and working well under pressure
● Cash handling and financial reconciliations 
● Answering incoming phone calls and resolving customer queries 
● Receiving and process orders for retail and wholesale customers
● Coordinating payments with the Accounts team
●Data entry and general administrative support duties using various software systems include Microsoft, Excel and CRM systems.
profile_positions.title: Barista & Administration Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description:
As a youth mentor my role was to provide social and emotional support as well as social upskilling to at risk young people. I achieved this by utilising my skills in building strong interpersonal relationships and by using a strengths based approach. This involved being ‘matched’ with a young person to support one-on-one as well as facilitating group work.

I volunteered not only at the YMCA vocational school but, on request, helped to implement a trial of the project within a state school in QLDs south-east region.

As part of my involvement, I was also involved in developing a mentoring resource intended as a national resource for the YMCA mentoring program. This collaborative resource enabled me to utilise my writing skills and team work to produce a guide detailing the expectations for new staff as well as a program outlines centred around activities and engagement resulting in socially upskilling young people.
Teaching English to children aged 4-15 in PIO school at Borei Keily in Cambodia.

Mirabel supports children aged 0-17 years and works at restoring a child’s sense of self-worth, belonging and hope for the future in order for them to reach their full potential as young adults

My role involves supporting at therapeutic girls groups as well as recreational camps by fostering a positive environment that young people can connect with each and develop confidence and self empowerment.
